creator: yoavs@computer.org
text:
Deleting a Context is not a good idea anyways: a Context is a Web Application. 
It should be stopped and undeployed from the Manager, not deleted from the Admin
webapp.

(In reply to comment #2)
> Deleting a Context is not a good idea anyways: a Context is a Web Application. 
> It should be stopped and undeployed from the Manager, not deleted from the Admin
> webapp.
You can provide a logical delete , the the corresponding entries in the
config.xml should get deleted and the web application should not be . I think
this is expected  from the user .
